comment: Hes nice and I can give him that, with that said he must be totally clueless about the rest of a students homework. He gives a ridiculous amount of work, for example he treats 4 page essays (which you have two of) as if they are simple worksheets. Along with the incredibly hard essays he was probably the most boring professor anyone could have.

Tough but fair. Assignment heavy but at least he warns you. Responds quickly to questions and is approachable. You really cannot calculate your grade the way d2l is setup. I used the book for quizzes (most of the questions came from the book). Doesn't assign groups so you gotta find one yourself. Quality of your group can make or break you.

Worst professor I have had. LOTS of indepth projects and he gives NO feedback on grades. He doesnt really teach, just assigns lots of work. I learned nothing from his class. You would be better off taking a Microsoft Office tutorial.

TAKE ONLINE. Never looked at lectures. I did the quizzes & exams thx to quizlets. So many tough Group/ Individual projects. SUPER hard ones.I saved so much time. I got the books but never used the codes, and got an A. Projects took me days to complete and we all had no clue what we were doing. Not a bad choice. A midterm and final plus projects.

Professor Carroll is a nice guy and his class isn't too difficult. The assignments can be a little tricky at times, but if you go to class he'll explain them further and is happy to answer questions. The final group project could mess up your grade depending on who your partners are.

A lot of ppl complain about him for no reason, he does make u work for the grade but all you have to do is literally follow the rubric for every assignment. All IS classes have a lot of work including this one but as long as you follow his rubric you will make an A. the quizzes and test are super easy. the assignments are difficult but can be done.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I really liked him! The class has assignments that require actual work, but if you give it some effort you can make A's on them all. Tests are easy if you study! A lot of people complained about him, but that is because they weren't ever in class and expected everything to be spoon fed to them. I would take him again in a heartbeat!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: By far the worst professor I've taken at KSU. Going to class is extremely pointless because he doesn't teach any material needed for most assignments. Multiple projects that are overwhelmingly difficult, and 18 quizzes throughout the semester. Again, assignments are VERY hard. Pick literally any other professor. You've been warned.
Easy professor! You have a lot of time to complete assignments , so just keep up with deadlines and should be an easy A.
There are labs even though its not a lab class but they are interesting. It was good to get a more technical class after all of the management classes we have to take.

Two major tests that are based on the quiz material. Lots of assignments that are worth small ports of your grade. Really is there for his students though. Book is needed for quizzes and cram for tests.
Gave opportunities for extra credit. Easy grader for the most part. Excel assignment is brutal.

I can easily say, I was not fond of this class. However, the class did boost my GPA. While there are a couple tedious assignments, you can do it. For the excel assignment, GO SEE A TUTOR. Just do it, and get it done. Books are totally unnecessary. Class time was not valuable for me, personally. Easy A! Take Professor Carroll.

Interesting teacher, a lot of real- world knowledge. There is no need to come to class, and most of the course work is easy. Just have to study for days and study hard for his tests because he makes them harder then they need to be.

In general the class is very easy. A couple of small assignments and a group project. There is an incredibly tedious excel project that is due early on in the semester, but I think this is something to expect in all IS 2200 classes. He doesn't spend any class time on it so you're on your own. Lectures are common sense so attendance isn't needed.

I tried to take this hybrid course without the text book. Doesn't work. I got a C when I easily could have had an A. Not sure what I was thinking. Carroll is a busy professional and always has great real world tie-ins. Nice person, heartfelt. He's a geek too, and I like that. Take his class if you want a good intro into ISA.

If you can turn your computer on you will pass this class. If you are very good in excel you will get an A. There is a project on excel worth %15 of your grade. Start it really early and Google how to input the different stuff.  I'm really good with excel and it took me 16 hours to complete. If you can read you can pass his tests.
